definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter

sentences.english: When the angle is small, the saturation control is replaced by the reverse square root control.
sentences.chinese: 小角度調轉時用反向開方代替飽和控制的三模態控制。

sentences.english: A wise doctor will diagnose before writing a prescription.
sentences.chinese: 明智的大夫在開方之前先診斷。

sentences.english: File does not exist or has improper access permissions.
sentences.chinese: 文件不存在或者打開方式不正確。

sentences.english: So it often takes lots of valuable time to do such calculating.
sentences.chinese: 所以常常爲開方計算而花費大量的寶貴時間。

sentences.english: The job is like that of a doctor, assessing the health of the company, diagnosing illness, and prescribing a course to recovery.
sentences.chinese: 有點象醫生，評估公司的健康情況，然後診斷開方。

sentences.english: Are you prescribing medicine for me?

definition: to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to pick the edible part of vegetables
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
